===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かたな}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かたな|片|t1=one side|tr1=kata|刃|t2=edge|tr2=na}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|y=k|acc=3|acc2=2|かたな}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かたな}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かたな|weaponry}} a single-[[edge]]d [[sword]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かたな|weaponry}} more specifically, a [[katana]]
# a small single-edged [[blade]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|small blade}} {{ja-l|切れ物|きれもの|kiremono}}

=====Coordinate terms=====
* {{ja-l|脇差|わきざし|wakizashi}} traditional Japanese [[shortsword]] (30cm to 60cm)
* {{ja-l|短刀|たんとう|tantō}} traditional Japanese [[knife]] or [[dagger]] (30cm and shorter)
* {{ja-l|大小|だいしょう|daishō}}: “big and small”: the ''katana'' and ''wakizashi'' as a [[set]]

=====Related terms=====
* {{sense|sword, two-edged}} {{ja-l|剣|つるぎ|tsurugi}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-l|刀市|かたないち|katana ichi}}: a [[sword]] [[market]]
* {{ja-l|刀引|かたなびき|katanabiki}}: [[giving]] a [[sword]] worn on one's hip to another as a [[gift]] at a [[banquet]] or other social [[gathering]]
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-l|小刀|こがたな|kogatana}}: a small [[knife]], a [[penknife]], a [[pocketknife]], a [[jackknife]]
* {{ja-l|腰刀|こしがたな|koshigatana}}: a hip-sword, smaller than a katana and with no {{m|ja|鍔|tr=tsuba||sword guard}}
{{der-bottom}}

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-l|刀折れ矢尽きる|かたなおれやつきる|katana ore ya tsukiru}}: “swords bent, out of arrows” → completely [[rout]]ed, a complete [[loss]] in [[battle]]
* {{ja-l|刀に懸けて|かたなにかけて|katana ni kakete}}: “[depending, swearing] on one's sword” → a metaphor for [[firm]] [[resolve]] to see something through
* {{ja-l|刀の錆び|かたなのさび|katana no sabi}}: “sword [[rust]]” → a metaphor for killing someone or being killed, from the way that [[blood]] can cause the [[steel]] of a sword to rust; a [[derogatory]] term for someone who isn't even worth [[soil]]ing a sword
{{der-bottom}}

{{ja-kanjitab|とう|yomi=o}}

{{ja-pron|とう|acc=a|y=o}}

{{ja-noun|とう|hhira=たう}}

# a [[sword]], a [[katana]]
# a [[scalpel]], such as that used by a [[surgeon]]
# a kind of [[bronze]] or [[copper]] [[money]] in ancient China, shaped a bit like a [[sword]]
